Description: Woman's necklace made of strings of irregularly shaped orange-red plastic (?) beads. The beads are arranged in ten strands, each originally containing five strings of beads. At either side of the necklace the strands are interrupted by a flat metal bar flanked on both sides by two red plastic (?) beads separated by a metal bead. The strands are pulled together at the ends of the necklace, the cotton thread on which the beads were strung is bound tightly with gold-dipped (?) thread to form a tapering conical shape. A brass hook and ring are attached to the cotton threads at the top of this cone. Two black cotton thread bands decorate the cone.
Condition: Fair; three of the strands have one string or partial string of beads missing.
Acquisition notes: Af1994,01.1 to 4 were purchased from J Stuart Ackary, and were descibed as "a small collection, mainly from Bahriyah Oasis in the Western Desert (Sahara) of Egypt, including an embroidered dress and other items of female personal adornment."
